humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that the largest invasive carcinoma is 2.5 cm in greatest linear dimension. Based on the rules provided, T2 tumors are more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm. Therefore, the pathologic T stage of the patient's cancer is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The patient's T stage is T2, which is determined by the size of the largest invasive carcinoma. In this report, the size of the largest invasive carcinoma is 2.5 cm, which falls within the T2 category (tumor size >2 cm and ≤5 cm). The other findings such as lymphovascular space invasion, margin status, and lymph node involvement are used for N and M staging, not T staging.
